titleStmt.title: London's triumph, or, The goldsmiths jubilee containing a description of the several pageants and speeches, made proper for the occasion, together with a song, for the entertainment of His Majesty, who, with His Royal Consort, the Queen Dowager, Their Royal Highnesses the Prince and Princess of Denmark, and the whole Court, honour His Lordship this year with their presence / by M. Taubman.
titleStmt.author: Taubman, Matthew, d. 1690?

titleStmt.title: London's triumph, or, The goldsmiths jubilee containing a description of the several pageants and speeches, made proper for the occasion, together with a song, for the entertainment of His Majesty, who, with His Royal Consort, the Queen Dowager, Their Royal Highnesses the Prince and Princess of Denmark, and the whole Court, honour His Lordship this year with their presence / by M. Taubman.
titleStmt.author: Taubman, Matthew, d. 1690?

notesStmt.note: "Performed on Saturday, October XXIX, 1687, for the confirmation and entertainment of the Right Honourable Sir John Shorter, Kt., Lord Mayor of the city of London."
"All set forth at the proper costs and charges of the Worshipful Company of Goldsmiths."
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
